unsuccessful_sms_delivery.description: NEST sent a SMS message to a customer, however the cell phone did not accept the SMS message. The customer must be contacted for a correct phone number

customers_with_no_welcome_pack_mails.description: List of customers for whom no Welcome pack mails are sent. Nesters need to check which welcome mail is missed and should manually send that mail to customer

customers_with_missing_dbs_records.description: List of customers who have missing daily billing status records

customers_with_zero_duc_records.title: Customers with zero duc records
customers_with_zero_duc_records.description: A meter is sending constant zero data to NEST or there are no duc records for the 5 consecutive days, or more. It’s highly likely that the meter is not communicating

transfers_not_completed_within_the_expec.title: Transfers not completed within the expected time frame
transfers_not_completed_within_the_expec.description: Transfers that have not been completed within the expected time frame, please review them and do needful action

customers_with_invalid_or_incomplete_con.description: List of customers whose concession details are invalid or having incomplete data

customer_signs_up_for_a_property_owned_b.description: Customer signs up for a property owned by ReAmped, Please review the records and make necessary changes

an_advance_customer_has_mismatched_billi.description: An Advance customer is either on an Advance price plan but has no billing product, or has an Advance billing product but no Advance price plan OR BS and BP dates are not set properly

sendgrid_status_customers_who_have_chang.description: Retrieves the sendgrid status of a communication sent to a customer’s old email id, when he changes his email id in the middle of LS process

products.title: Retailer-initiated de-energisation of premises – small customers
products.description: Retailer-initiated de-energisation of premises – small customers

rule_116_1b_customer_life_support_discon.title: Retail Rules, Part 6 Divisions 1 and 2 Rule 116 (1)(b) - Customers on life support and are scheduled for disconnection
rule_116_1b_customer_life_support_discon.description: Despite any other provisions of this Division but subject to subrule (2), (3) and (4), a retailer must not arrange for a de-energisation of a customer's premises to occur:(b) where the customer has made a complaint, directly related to the reason for the proposed de-energisation, to the retailer under the retailer’s standard complaints and dispute resolution procedures, and the complaint remains unresolved; ;

rule_116_1b_customer_disconnection_and_c.title: Retail Rules, Part 6 Divisions 1 and 2 Rule 116 (1)(b) - Customers scheduled for disconnection and have made a complaint
rule_116_1b_customer_disconnection_and_c.description: Despite any other provisions of this Division but subject to subrule (2), (3) and (4), a retailer must not arrange for a de-energisation of a customer's premises to occur:(b) where the customer has made a complaint, directly related to the reason for the proposed de-energisation, to the retailer under the retailer’s standard complaints and dispute resolution procedures, and the complaint remains unresolved; ;

retailer_initiated_de_energisation_1d.title: Retail Rules, Part 6 Divisions 1 and 2 Rule 116 (1)(d) - Customers that are on or have had a payment plan and are scheduled for disconnection
retailer_initiated_de_energisation_1d.description: Despite any other provisions of this Division but subject to subrule (2), (3) and (4), a retailer must not arrange for a de-energisation of a customer's premises to occur:(c) where the customer has made a complaint, directly related to the reason for the proposed de-energisation, to the energy ombudsman, and the complaint remains unresolved; ;
